Class CardPile

    • CardPile

extends Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardPile()
      This constructor simply creates an empty CardPile.
      CardPile(ArrayList<Card> other)
      This constructor accepts an ArrayList of cards passed in as an argument.
      CardPile(Card... card)
      This constructor accepts an arbitrary number of Card objects passed in as an argument.
      CardPile(CardPile other)
      This copy constructor accepts another CardPile passed in as an argument.

    • Field Detail

      • cards

        private ArrayList<Card> cards

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardPile

        public CardPile()
        This constructor simply creates an empty CardPile.

      • CardPile

        public CardPile(CardPile other)
        This copy constructor accepts another CardPile passed in as an argument. It then gets each card from it and copies them over to the new CardPile.
        Parameters:
        other - The CardPile to be copied.

      • CardPile

        public CardPile(ArrayList<Card> other)
        This constructor accepts an ArrayList of cards passed in as an argument. It then gets each card from it and copies them over to the new CardPile.
        Parameters:
        other - The ArrayList to be copied.

      • CardPile

        public CardPile(Card... card)
        This constructor accepts an arbitrary number of Card objects passed in as an argument. It then adds them to the new CardPile.
        Parameters:
        card - The array of cards to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • numCards

        public int numCards()
        The numCards method returns the size of the CardPile.
        Returns:
        The size of the CardPile.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        The addCard method accepts a Card object passed in as an argument. It then adds the Card to the end of the CardPile.
        Parameters:
        card - The Card object to be added.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(int index,
           Card card)
        The overloaded addCard method accepts an index and a Card object as an argument. It then adds the Card object at the specified index in the CardPile.
        Parameters:
        index - The index for the Card to be added at.
        card - The Card object to be added.

      • setCard

        public void setCard(int index,
           Card card)
        The setCard method accepts an integer for an index and a Card object passed in as an argument, and then sets the Card object at the specified index. If the index is out of the bounds of the CardPile, prints an error message saying so.
        Parameters:
        index - The index for the card to be set at.
        card - The Card object to be set at the specified index.

      • removeCard

        public void removeCard(Card card)
        The removeCard method accepts a Card object passed in as an argument. It then removes the Card from the CardPile. If it cannot find the card, prints an error message.
        Parameters:
        card - The Card object to be removed.

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int index)
        The getCard method accepts an integer passed in as an argument, then returns the card at that index. If the index is below zero or greater than the size of the CardPile, prints an error message and returns null.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the card to be returned.

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        The removeAll method simply removes all of the cards from the pile.

      • getHalf

        public CardPile getHalf(int from,
               int to)
        The getHalf method accepts two ints as arguments for a starting and ending index. It then creates a subList using those ints, turns it into a CardPile, and returns it.
        Parameters:
        from - The index to start at.
        to - The index to end at.
        Returns:
        The new part of the CardPile.

      • flipTop

        public Card flipTop()
        The flipTop method simulates flipping a card off of the top of the CardPile. It gets the Card object at the end of the CardPile, then removes it from the CardPile and returns it.
        Returns:
        The Card object at the end of the CardPile.
